Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Le Ing O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in China town which was not the cleanest or safest at night. However the hotel was walking distance to Wall Street and World Trade Center as well as the subways. Added bonus was the Asian buns for breakfast in the tea room and cheap Asian food in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I have a rash on my face”
Reviews.Author: V R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: First, this is not a Hotel is a Motel. They do not use mattress, they only use the box spring with a blanket over it. It's like sleeping on a table with sheets. I have no problems with noise, but there is a train station right in front of the hotel. and works 24 hours. The heating does not work. I have a rash on the face, backache........ OMG

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: catloversCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I was a bit cautious about quality of the beds in this hotel after reading other reviews but found the beds adequate and definitely not too hard as indicated. This hotel caters mostly for the Chinese community. The rooms were clean and the lady tidying up the rooms, Hau, was not only very efficient but also honest as she found an article lying behind the bed and left it on the bed after servicing the room. I found the front desk staff friendly and very helpful, the breakfast was not quite what one would expect according to Western standards but it was filling. The hotel is also quite close to the subway. It is located in a Chinese community, close to Canal street. The room was also not very noisy due to the double glazed windows. The only problem I had with the hotel was that there is some problem with their plumbing system as the toilet became blocked on a day that we were not in the hotel. However this was quickly solved.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfectly clean”
Reviews.Author: Zaragrodan
Reviews.Content: If you´re only looking for a place to crash and don´t plan on staying in your room too much then this is a superb choice. Dead cheap, dead clean and fairly central. Close proximity to metro station, safe area, tv, free coffee. Small bedroom but big bathroom. Room was cleaned daily and sheets changed every other day. Brilliant find.

Reviews.Title: “No longer an America's Best Value Inn......”
Reviews.Author: torresongs
Reviews.Content: However the Mayor Hotel still benefits from the renovation that ABV did a few years back. The rooms are clean, the bathrooms fixtures are relatively new, and all the rooms are equipped with cable and flat screen TV's. The location is in the lower East Side in the heart of Chinatown. Proximity to Little Italy is very convenient. The neighborhood is mostly quiet except for the train that goes over the Manhattan bridge periodically. However the rooms have doubled paned windows which filter this out a bit. If your goal is Midtown, you have many options on the subway that will get you there in under 10 mins. Much faster and more affordable than taxis. The ferries for Staten Island and the Statue of Liberty are about a 5 min bus ride away. You can literally walk to the Financial District and the WTC site. The Mayor is definitely the cleanest, safest hotel for the price in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and good value”
Reviews.Author: dkhTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our flight landed in New York in the morning, several hours before checkin. The staff was helpful in getting our room ready quickly. The room was large by New York standards and everything was in good condition. Chinatown is very working class and a bit dirty, but we enjoyed our stay there. There were plenty of place to get food and coffee nearby. In particular, I recommend the Chinese pastry shops. The subway was a short walk from the hotel, so it is quick to get to most of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “better than a hostel”
Reviews.Author: MichelleYHK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only for one night and my friend booked the room. The room is clean and the bed is comfortable. Not that noisy as other reviewers said. At least I had a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Mayor Hotel in NYC - spend $50 more per night and rest easy”
Reviews.Author: skiv
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is not the best in my experience. Tough to grab a cab and I wouldn't feel comfortable walking the neighborhood at night. The hotel is cheap for NYC but you get what you pay for. The bed felt like I was sleeping on a box spring with no mattress. Hotel was small and very noisy. I heard a lot of people coming and going and constant "bing" from the elevator. Staff of 1 was barely present. When I arrived at my hotel at midnight the door was ope ad there was nobody at the front desk. Anyone could have walked in off of the street.. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad, as people say.”
Reviews.Author: Dodoinge
Reviews.Content: Yes, there is a train passing by this hotel, but your not in this city to sleep te whole day. it is The city that never sleeps. So after a daywalking around in this beautiful city, you will get tired and probebly have a very nice sleep. The people in the front desk, is very polite and helpfull, even at night time:) and also the housekeepers will always be there for you with a new towel. We loved this hotel, and we are Norwegians:P

Reviews.Title: “Cheap place to crash. Bad for light sleepers...”
Reviews.Author: hipsfan
Reviews.Content: I read the (mostly negative) reviews before I stayed at this hotel, and decided to try it anyway to save some money. I was just in town one night to see a band and I was by myself. Hotel was recently updated and is in decent shape. Hotel staff was friendly. Room was small, but bathroom was decent size. The beds aren't as bad as some people have stated but are by no means great. The main problem with this hotel is that the trains constantly run and it's LOUD. I was awoken repeatedly - it sounds and feels like an earthquake. I am normally not someone who gets up at every little sound. I'm guess I would stay here again for one night if I was on a budget, but if you are trying to have a relaxing time, consider whether you can afford a few extra bucks to stay somewhere without the train commotion.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here - Please Listen!”
Reviews.Author: FatRUby2
Reviews.Content: This seemed like a good deal, i had booked 5 nights for $525, when I arrived they added 15% tax (NY tax is 6% ). Then they couldnt get my card to work on their machine so i had to go and get cash out. At 0130 the fire alarm went off in my room (only my room) the night guard came up after some strong words from me and ripped the alarm off the wall to stop the noise. I write this 3 days later and the fire alarm is still off the wall. I went down for the so - called breakfast to find that the 'breakfast room' is a small closet in the basement and there were two boxes of stale bread and a coffee machine with nowhere to sit! The room was ok in size and was clean, but the bed was like concorete! I dont mind a bit of noise outside but this hotel is just a roadwidth from the main rail line with trains passing by every 2 minutes which actually made my window rattle. It is like being at the end of a runway! The area of china town the hotel is located in is very dirty and dodgy and it takes a good 10 minutes walking to get to the metro. I hope my review prevents you from staying here, its a crumby hotel. I hope my next one is better!. Stay in mid manhattan and pay a few dollars more for a better experience Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Please, Please, Please Do Not Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Burley42
Reviews.Content: You deserve better, dont do this to yourself. We were gonna stay 2 nights. But the 1st night was awful. The bed is so hard that we couldnt sleep at all. I tried to see was it a mattress on there and it was not at all. It is a boxspring with a board on it. So the next morning I walked over to Hotel 91 to see if they had a room and they did. I complained to the front desk at the Mayor and nothing at all seem to bother them. They said that the manager would call me and she never did. The noise really didnt bother me cause I was up anyway from the bad bed. The water was hot. The room was clean and cold. A young lady lied to me on the phone about how close this was to all the shopping and it's very far. Please do not book this hotel because of the price. It is not healthy for you as well. The floor was more comfortable than the bed. But you didnt have much room on the floor cause the room was small.

Reviews.Title: “I do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Garotis
Reviews.Content: The hotel is recent and clean. The front desk staff members were pleasant and helpful and we had no problems with water. Besides, the B/DF subway stations are walking distance. The Manhattan Bridge where trains run constantly is very near and it is noisy, but we had no problems. However, I do not recommend the hotel. Before this hotel, we had been before some days in upper town and we had spent less and the hotel was better. I did not like the location. It is not necessary to be in Chinatown if you are interested in visit this interesting part of the city. In this trip to NY, I booked this hotel by Hotwire and I booked another by ourselves. We had chosen to stay some days in upper and some in down town. In fact, I think that the hotel that I booked by ourselves was much better. I do not intend to use hotwire again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: UkUKvisitor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an interesting, vibrant neighbourhood, in which I felt safe, even late at night. the train is noisy but didn't bother me at all during my stay. The rooms are small, but clean and the staff were extremely professional and helpful. An entirely positive stay, but the bed was the hardest in the universe!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: bunodid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is recent, pleasant and clean. The room was clean too, even if quite small. However, I experienced several little problems with the bathroom: very low pressure on the bath, a toilet leak and towels unchanged / dirty. The second matter was never fixed. I had to turn off the pipe every time I was not using the toilets to avoid a flood. The first problem was resolved by itself ie by turning off the toilet pipe, there was a lot of pressure in the bath! And about the third problem, I complained on the second day. Afterwards, the towels were always changed and clean. Otherwise, the room was too cold for me with the air conditioning. No possibility to adjust it (one thermostat per floor). The location is ok, near Canal Street. The tube is at 5 /10 minutes walk. However, I could hear the tube from the room, so air plugs are necessary to sleep. Nevertheless, I globally found the hotel ok for the price. I would recommend it to friends who want to discover New York and so stay at the hotel just to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “it Suited the purpose”
Reviews.Author: HoboV
Reviews.Content: Train is a problem very Noisy. Staff were pleasant and helpful The water problems seem to be sorted as everything was in order in Sept. Location is a subway ride away from Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best But Definitely Not the Worst in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: JoseMartinezSr
Reviews.Content: I'm frequently in New York City so I've spent many nights in different hotels all around Manhattan. I am use to staying at hotels that run from $350-$600 a night. Due to a recent budget cut, my company booked me for a week stay at the Mayor Hotel. The rates at this hotel are the lowest I've seen in NYC and there are a few other hotels nearby (much older looking) that charge more. The hotel is fairly new; I was told it opened two months ago. And based on the appearance, design of the hotel, and the cleanliness of the lobby, rooms, hallways, and elevator, it's most likely true. The Front Desk staff members are knowledgeable of the area and answered all my questions in good manners. The rooms are a bit small but not much smaller than Four Points Sheraton in Chelsea which charge 2-3x as much. The B/DF subway stations are walking distance so it's very convenient for me to go to my meetings. The biggest con is that the Hotel is directly across the Manhattan Bridge where trains run by constantly. During the morning and afternoon, it does get pretty loud. At night, the trains run less frequently and it becomes more forgiving; at least to me. My room was cleaned everyday and although I did make two complaints to the general manager regarding certain things I disliked, she handled those issues very well and I didn't have a problem for the remaining of my stay. I did not run into any water issues during my entire stay (1wk) like others have. So I cannot comment on that. Overall, I think for the price, cleanliness, and convenience factor, I would give it 3 stars at least. I think since the hotel is still fairly new, some adjustments will have to be made; but it does seem to have a potential to be a 4 star Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: Capitainetroisvilles
Reviews.Content: A SHAME. OUTRAGEOUS. Staff was arrogant, unhelpful and unprofessional, except for the hotel manager. I have NEVER been treated like that in a hotel. The room did not have hot water, they totally ignored my complain and made me wait for hours until they gave us a new room. The following day they gave that same room to a guest who complained about the same problem, obviously they never tried to fix it. AC could not be turned off, but if we opened the window we could not get any sleep because of the noise. Room was so small we could not walk around the bed without stumbling with our bags. I WILL NEVER USE THIS HOTEL AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “May be disappointing for long stay”
Reviews.Author: leepstore
Reviews.Content: When we arrived everything looked good and comfortable. But after having spend 1 night we had some noticable disappointments: - The subway passes by in the nights which can be disturbing ( we stayed more than a week so we got used to it) - The shower tub is indeed very very poor, theres almost no water coming out of it. Taking a nice hot shower after a warm day is out of the mind. The staff crew cannot fix it either after informing them. - The prices were pretty expensive: We could have booked more comfortable hotels for the same price. Plusses are: -Mostly friendly crew -Hotel seems clean -Good airconditioning - Good location in southern manhattan (Soho, Chinatown, little italy etc.) So if ur here for a short visit it might be worth a while cause of its good location but for a longer visit it might be better to book another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not an option”
Reviews.Author: JJOSFO
Reviews.Content: It is located in an a busy area of China town with a subway right above. When we heard the train go by every few min and walking into our room that had not been cleaned, we advised them we were not staying.! There are so many other options of hotels in NY and this is not one of them.
